findings.title: Unsalted HKDF in utils.py
findings.description: The `kdf` function in `utils.py` sets salt to `None`, which can lead to brute-force attacks.

findings.title: Multiple issues related to curve specification
findings.description: Inconsistent curve parameters and assumptions lead to functionality bugs and potential decryption failures.

findings.title: Multiple issues related to parametrization over arbitrary curves
findings.description: Umbral implementation allows for arbitrary elliptic curves, which can cause undefined behavior and security issues.

findings.title: Insufficient validation of signatures
findings.description: The Signature class implements no verification for the r and s parameters, allowing for the construction of signatures that donâ€™t depend on the private key used to sign.

findings.title: Network cannot detect malicious nodes
findings.description: NuCypherKMS does not currently have a way to establish whether a miner is performing valid re-encryptions, leading to potential DoS attacks and malicious node activity.

findings.title: Transaction Reordering Attack on approve function
findings.description: A race condition in the ERC20 standard allows an attacker to take more tokens than allotted with approve by reordering transactions.

findings.title: Transaction Reordering Attack on decreaseApproval function
findings.description: A similar vulnerability exists in decreaseApproval, allowing an attacker to dequeue a transfer between its origination and resolution.

findings.title: Server implements no rate-limiting functionality
findings.description: Lack of rate limiting makes it easy for clients to exhaust server resources.

findings.title: Database has no snapshot and rollback functionality
findings.description: No solution to revert changes in case of database issues.

findings.title: Lack of anonymity allows collusion-based attacks
findings.description: Re-encryption nodes can acquire information about senders and recipients.

findings.title: Database has no access controls
findings.description: Unencrypted sqlite database with no permission-based access controls.

findings.title: ProxyRESTServer.set_policy can be used to invalidate policy arrangements
findings.description: An attacker can make policy arrangements held by any node effectively useless.

findings.title: Several issues related to policy issuance
findings.description: Multiple issues in the policy system, including lack of signing and validation, enable replay attacks.

findings.title: Work orders have no protection from replay attacks
findings.description: Work order submission process lacks blockchain component and protection against replay attacks.

findings.title: Ursula's responses are unauthenticated
findings.description: Ursula never signs her response to work orders, allowing impersonation.

findings.title: Unused constants KFRAG_LENGTH and CFRAG_LENGTH_WITHOUT_PROOF
findings.description: These constants are neither initialized nor used anywhere else in the codebase.

findings.title: Unused constant _EXPECTED_LENGTH
findings.description: This constant is unused in the codebase.

findings.title: No self-transfer allowed in NuCypherKMSToken
findings.description: Transfers from a person to themselves are not allowed via transfer or transferFrom, causing unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Blockchain portion of the system is not ERC900 compatible
findings.description: The blockchain portion of the system implements staking but is not ERC900 compatible.

findings.title: Unused label in smart contract
findings.description: There is an unused label in the smart contract.

findings.title: unsafe label in smart contract
findings.description: The label in the smart contract can cause unexpected behavior.
